snippet: A senior French diplomat said the government was providing funds to five revolutionary councils in rebel-held parts of Syria to help them restore water supplies, sanitation, health services and bakeries.
abstract: French government is providing funds to five revolutionary councils in rebel-held parts of Syria to help them restore water supplies, sanitation, health services and bakeries; plan is part of effort to help fill vacuum in civilian services left in areas where the Syrian government is not functioning.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Paris, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: A senior French diplomat said the government was providing funds to five revolutionary councils in rebel-held parts of Syria to help them restore water supplies, sanitation, health services and bakeries.

headline.seo: France Sends Funds to 5 Syrian Civic Groups
headline.main: France Sends Funds to 5 Syrian Civic Groups in Rebel-Held Areas
headline.print_headline: France Sends Funds to 5 Syrian Civic Groups in Rebel-Held Areas

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
